title: Essay
description: Structured writing task that synthesises research into a cohesive argument.

milestones.name: Read instructions
milestones.description: Read the full assignment instructions and any associated materials. Focus on the rubric to understand required sources, structure, and referencing style. Seek clarification early if anything is unclear.

milestones.name: Break down question
milestones.description: Highlight key task words and clarify what the assignment is asking you to do. Refine the topic scope so you can plan targeted research and writing. Attend a drop-in session if you need support interpreting the brief.

milestones.name: Do some general research
milestones.description: Identify what you already know and what gaps you must fill. Explore broad sources to form an initial position on the topic. Consult with a librarian for search strategies if needed.

milestones.name: Brainstorm and plan your answers
milestones.description: Generate ideas for your argument and decide on a clear thesis. Outline paragraphs with one main point each and note supporting evidence to find. Continue targeted research to back each main idea.

milestones.name: Alternate writing and further research
milestones.description: Draft body paragraphs while gathering any missing evidence. Structure introduction and conclusion from general to specific. Reference sources as you go to keep citations accurate.

milestones.name: Edit and redraft
milestones.description: Review structure, flow, and sources before refining wording and referencing. Confirm every paragraph links back to your central thesis. Proofread carefully and ensure the rubric requirements are satisfied.

milestones.name: Submit
milestones.description: Verify submission receipt and store confirmation safely.
